name: Evening Primrose
climate: The evening primrose thrives in temperate climates with moderate temperatures.
It can tolerate some subtropical climates with proper care and watering.
This plant does not perform well in extremely cold or arid climates.
Evening primrose prefers climates with mild summers and cool winters.
sunlight: Evening primrose grows best in full sun to ensure high flower yield.
It can tolerate light shade, but this may reduce flowering potential.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can prevent leaf scorch.
Consistent sunlight exposure is essential for optimal growth and blooming.
watering: The plant prefers a moderate watering schedule, allowing soil to dry between waterings.
Avoid overwatering, as evening primrose is susceptible to root rot in soggy soil.
Drought tolerant once established, but performs best with regular moisture.
Water deeply once a week during prolonged dry spells or extreme heat.
soil: Evening primrose thrives in well-draining, sandy or loamy soils.
Soils rich in organic matter will promote optimal growth and flowering.
Avoid heavy clay soils, which can retain too much moisture and harm roots.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH is ideal for the health of this plant.
extra_care_tip: To encourage more blooms, deadhead spent flowers throughout the season.
Apply a slow-release, balanced fertilizer once in early spring for best results.
